title: scvi_leiden
description: Run scvi integration followed by neighbour calculations, leiden clustering and run umap on the result.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

id.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample
id.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `dataset.h5mu`. Path to the sample
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `dataset.h5mu`. Path to the sample.

layer.description: Type: `string`. use specified layer for expression values instead of the
layer.help_text: Type: `string`. use specified layer for expression values instead of the .X object from the modality.

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Destination path to the output
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Destination path to the output.

output_model.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output_model.output_model`, example: `output_dir`. Folder where the state of the trained model will be saved to
output_model.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output_model.output_model`, example: `output_dir`. Folder where the state of the trained model will be saved to.

uns_neighbors.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `scvi_integration_neighbors`. In which .uns slot to store various neighbor output objects.

obsp_neighbor_distances.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `scvi_integration_distances`. In which .obsp slot to store the distance matrix between the resulting neighbors.

obsp_neighbor_connectivities.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `scvi_integration_connectivities`. In which .obsp slot to store the connectivities matrix between the resulting neighbors.

obs_batch.description: Type: `string`, required. Column name discriminating between your batches
obs_batch.help_text: Type: `string`, required. Column name discriminating between your batches.

obsm_output.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_scvi_integrated`. In which .obsm slot to store the resulting integrated embedding.

var_input.help_text: Type: `string`. .var column containing highly variable genes. By default, do not subset genes.

early_stopping.description: Type: `boolean`. Whether to perform early stopping with respect to the validation set
early_stopping.help_text: Type: `boolean`. Whether to perform early stopping with respect to the validation set.

early_stopping_monitor.description: Type: `string`, default: `elbo_validation`, choices: ``elbo_validation`, `reconstruction_loss_validation`, `kl_local_validation``. Metric logged during validation set epoch
early_stopping_monitor.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `elbo_validation`, choices: ``elbo_validation`, `reconstruction_loss_validation`, `kl_local_validation``. Metric logged during validation set epoch.

early_stopping_patience.description: Type: `integer`, default: `45`. Number of validation epochs with no improvement after which training will be stopped
early_stopping_patience.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `45`. Number of validation epochs with no improvement after which training will be stopped.

early_stopping_min_delta.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.0`. Minimum change in the monitored quantity to qualify as an improvement, i
early_stopping_min_delta.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `0.0`. Minimum change in the monitored quantity to qualify as an improvement, i.e. an absolute change of less than min_delta, will count as no improvement.

max_epochs.description: Type: `integer`. Number of passes through the dataset, defaults to (20000 / number of cells) * 400 or 400; whichever is smallest
max_epochs.help_text: Type: `integer`. Number of passes through the dataset, defaults to (20000 / number of cells) * 400 or 400; whichever is smallest.

reduce_lr_on_plateau.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to monitor validation loss and reduce learning rate when validation set `lr_scheduler_metric` plateaus
reduce_lr_on_plateau.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to monitor validation loss and reduce learning rate when validation set `lr_scheduler_metric` plateaus.

lr_factor.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.6`. Factor to reduce learning rate
lr_factor.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `0.6`. Factor to reduce learning rate.

lr_patience.description: Type: `double`, default: `30.0`. Number of epochs with no improvement after which learning rate will be reduced
lr_patience.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `30.0`. Number of epochs with no improvement after which learning rate will be reduced.

obs_cluster.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `scvi_integration_leiden`. Prefix for the .obs keys under which to add the cluster labels. Newly created columns in .obs will 
be created from the specified value for '--obs_cluster' suffixed with an underscore and one of the resolutions
resolutions specified in '--leiden_resolution'.

leiden_resolution.description: Type: List of `double`, default: `1.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Control the coarseness of the clustering
leiden_resolution.help_text: Type: List of `double`, default: `1.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Control the coarseness of the clustering. Higher values lead to more clusters.

obsm_umap.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_scvi_umap`. In which .obsm slot to store the resulting UMAP embedding.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
